articles.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for Third Quarter Fiscal 2025
articles.summary: NVIDIA reported record quarterly revenue of $35.1 billion for the third quarter of fiscal 2025, a 94% increase year-over-year, driven by strong growth in Data Center revenue which reached $30.8 billion. The company highlighted the ongoing impact of AI across industries and revised its outlook for the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025 with expected revenue of $37.5 billion.

articles.title: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA)-Makes Big Beat on Earnings, But Stock May Need Santa to Propel to New All Time High
articles.summary: Nvidia Corp. (NVDA) reported strong third-quarter earnings, surpassing Wall Street expectations and easing concerns about AI-related valuations, with CEO Jensen Huang emphasizing a foundational transformation in computing. While the beat indicates strong momentum, the stock might remain range-bound in the near term between $190 and $212. A "Santa Claus rally" or positive macro data, alongside sustained demand and successful platform rollouts, could propel the stock to new highs.

articles.title: Why Nvidia Earnings May Trigger Massive S&P 500 Volatility
articles.summary: Nvidia's upcoming earnings report is anticipated to cause significant volatility in the S&P 500, with options markets predicting a larger impact than typical economic data releases. Given Nvidia's substantial contribution to the S&P 500's returns and EPS growth, its performance is seen as a key indicator for overall market sentiment. Traders are considering hedging strategies, such as put spreads on the Nasdaq-100 ETF, in anticipation of potential market turbulence.

articles.title: nVent collaborates with Nvidia on AI-ready liquid cooling solutions
articles.summary: nVent announced its collaboration with Nvidia to deploy liquid cooling solutions for hyperscale and high-performance computing data centers, specifically for the Nvidia GB200 NVL72 and next-generation platforms. This partnership aims to enhance performance and energy efficiency using nVent's customized cooling technology, which includes coolant distribution units, liquid-to-air heat exchangers, and manifold products. The collaboration also extends to delivering solutions for the Open Compute Project (OCP) community to address demand and improve reliability in data centers.

articles.title: Palantir and Nvidia rank high on list of companies with rising sales estimates
articles.summary: This article identifies 15 stocks, including Palantir and Nvidia, whose sales estimates have increased the most during the current earnings season. It highlights that despite warnings about high stock valuations, the market, exemplified by the S&P 500 and Nvidia, continues to rise. The analysis also notes that the forward P/E ratio for the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust is currently higher than its five and ten-year averages.

articles.title: Palantir and Nvidia rank high on list of companies with rising sales estimates
articles.summary: This article highlights 15 stocks, including Palantir and Nvidia, that have seen the largest increases in sales estimates during the current earnings season. Despite warnings about high stock valuations, exemplified by the S&P 500 and Nvidia, these companies demonstrate strong upward revisions in future revenue projections. The article notes the current forward P/E ratio of the SPDR S&P 500 ETF Trust is significantly higher than its historical averages.

articles.title: Amazon.com (AMZN) Invests $4B in Anthropic: A Strategic Move to Challenge NVIDIA in AI
articles.summary: Amazon.com (AMZN) has invested $4 billion in AI startup Anthropic, aiming to challenge NVIDIA's dominance in the AI chip market. This strategic move is intended to make Amazon's Neuron SDK more appealing by having Anthropic teams work directly with AWS personnel to facilitate customer transitions from NVIDIA. The article also touches upon the broader adoption of AI in manufacturing and its observed benefits like increased efficiency and productivity.

articles.title: Wall Street’s hottest stock, Palantir, only employs 3,892 people
articles.summary: Palantir (PLTR) has become the S&P 500's best-performing stock, reaching a $150 billion market capitalization despite having fewer than 4,000 employees. The company's shares surged after strong third-quarter earnings, driven by demand for its AI platform, and a planned move to Nasdaq. This remarkable valuation highlights a growing trend in AI-adjacent stocks where market cap per employee is a significant metric.

articles.title: European AI infra company Nebius nabs $700M from Nvidia, Accel, others
articles.summary: Nebius, a European AI infrastructure company formerly known as Yandex N.V., has raised $700 million from investors including Nvidia, Accel, and Orbis, to fund its U.S. expansion. The company plans to use the capital to build out its data center footprint, employing a hybrid approach with co-location facilities and greenfield sites. This funding, combined with existing capital, brings Nebius's total available funds to build infrastructure to around $3 billion, with further capital raises anticipated, and the company projects an annualized run rate of $750 million to $1 billion by the end of 2025.

articles.title: Ansys Accelerates CFD Simulation by 110x with NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper Superchips
articles.summary: Ansys announced that its Fluent CFD simulation software achieved a 110x acceleration using NVIDIA GH200 Grace Hopper Superchips, reducing a four-week simulation to six hours. This significant advancement, demonstrated at the Texas Advanced Computing Center (TACC) with a 2.4-billion-cell automotive external aerodynamics simulation, enables faster, higher-fidelity simulations and improves R&D processes across various industries. The collaboration highlights the power of GPU-accelerated computing in tackling complex engineering problems with greater efficiency and reduced computational resources.

articles.title: Monolithic Power Stock: Buy, Sell, or Hold?
articles.summary: Monolithic Power Systems (MPWR) stock has significantly underperformed the S&P 500 in 2024, experiencing a sharp sell-off after Q3 earnings and concerns about reduced orders from a key customer, Nvidia. Despite these setbacks and mixed analyst sentiment, the stock is considered a "Strong Buy" overall, with a mean price target suggesting substantial upside. Investors are grappling with whether recent drops fully price in performance and order-related risks.

articles.title: The 2025 Investment Outlook for Financial Advisors
articles.summary: Morningstar's 2025 Investment Outlook for Financial Advisors discusses key investment themes for the coming year, including opportunities outside the US due to high valuations in American stocks, strategies for generating returns in a falling rate environment, and considerations for investing in private assets. The outlook also details the evolving impact of AI on both investment portfolios and financial advisor practices. It aims to help advisors navigate challenges and opportunities for their clients in 2025.

articles.title: Under the Hood of Fidelity’s Blue Chip Growth ETF
articles.summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) is an actively managed U.S. equity growth strategy that has significantly outperformed its benchmark, the Russel 1000 Growth index. The fund employs bottom-up fundamental analysis to identify blue chip companies with sustainable business models, high returns on equity, and strong earnings growth, including both mega-cap and emerging companies. FBCG's active management and investment strategy have led to attractive returns for investors.

articles.title: The Smartest Megacap Growth ETF to Buy With $500 Right Now
articles.summary: This article recommends the Vanguard Mega Cap Growth ETF (MGK) as a top investment for those seeking exposure to leading growth stocks, especially in technology and other high-potential industries, for as little as $500. The ETF has significantly outperformed the S&P 500 in both the short and long term, boasting a low expense ratio and diversified holdings including Apple, Nvidia, and Microsoft. It highlights the benefits of ETFs for easy diversification and access to market-leading companies without requiring extensive individual stock research.

articles.title: BSTZ: Technology Growth Fund Yields 12% And (Still) Trades At Wide Discount To NAV
articles.summary: The article recommends investing in BlackRock Science and Technology Term Trust (BSTZ) for high-yield income, highlighting its top holdings in NVIDIA and other growth tech stocks. BSTZ offers a 12.3% yield at a -9.8% discount to NAV, with a liquidation event scheduled for 2031. Despite macroeconomic risks, the fund's strategy including private investments and covered calls, along with its high distribution rate, makes it a Buy.

articles.title: GlobalFoundries fined $500K over export violations
articles.summary: GlobalFoundries has been fined $500,000 by the Department of Commerce for violating federal export restrictions by shipping $17.1 million worth of semiconductor wafers to China-based SJ Semiconductor. SJ Semiconductor is on the U.S. entity list, and GlobalFoundries failed to obtain the necessary licenses due to a data entry error. The company voluntarily disclosed the transactions and cooperated with the investigation, leading to a reduced penalty.

articles.title: Wells Fargo Sticks to Their Buy Rating for CoreWeave (CRWV)
articles.summary: Wells Fargo analyst Michael Turrin maintained a Buy rating for CoreWeave (CRWV) with a price target of $150.00, despite negative corporate insider sentiment surrounding the stock. CoreWeave reported quarterly revenue of $1.36 billion and a GAAP net loss of $110.12 million for the quarter ending September 30. Other analysts have varying ratings, including a Buy from Compass Point and a Hold from TR | OpenAI – 4o.

articles.title: Under the Hood of Fidelity’s Blue Chip Growth
articles.summary: The Fidelity Blue Chip Growth ETF (FBCG) is an active U.S. equity growth strategy with a large-cap bias that has outperformed its benchmark, the Russel 1000 Growth index. The fund focuses on identifying blue chip companies with sustainable business models, high returns on equity, and strong revenue and earnings growth through bottom-up fundamental analysis. FBCG's portfolio includes both mega-cap companies and smaller emerging growers, aiming for consistent +10% annual EPS growth.

articles.title: Is Monolithic Power Systems a Screaming Buy After Near 40% Drop?
articles.summary: Monolithic Power Systems (NASDAQ: MPWR) has seen its stock drop nearly 40% since late October despite beating Q3 revenue and EPS expectations. The drop is attributed to a failure to raise guidance and a report suggesting potential loss of NVIDIA orders, though Monolithic denies these claims. With other business segments rebounding and analysts maintaining optimistic price targets, the article suggests the stock may be a strong buy on discount despite recent headwinds.

articles.title: Should iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) Be on Your Investing Radar?
articles.summary: The iShares S&P 500 Growth ETF (IVW) offers broad exposure to the Large Cap Growth segment of the US equity market, with significant holdings in Information Technology, and top positions in Nvidia, Apple, and Microsoft. With an expense ratio of 0.18% and a "Buy" rating from Zacks, it presents a compelling option for investors seeking growth, despite the inherent volatility of growth stocks. The fund has shown strong performance, up about 34.84% year-to-date and 40% over the last year.

articles.title: Amazon to pilot AI-designed material for carbon removal
articles.summary: Amazon plans to pilot a new carbon-removal material designed by AI from the startup Orbital Materials for its data centers, which are significant contributors to emissions due to their energy needs. This initiative aims to mitigate the environmental impact of AI development and data center operations, posing a potential cost-saving alternative to traditional carbon offsets. The pilot, part of a three-year partnership, will start in 2025 at one data center, with Orbital Materials also using AWS technology.

articles.title: Special Report: Astoria’s 10 ETFs for 2025
articles.summary: Astoria Portfolio Advisors releases its "10 ETFs for 2025" report, advising investors to prepare for a potential "Trump Put" and a shift in market leadership towards small-caps, mid-caps, cyclicals, and real assets. The report suggests reducing exposure to mega-cap growth stocks, being tactical in fixed income, and considering Ethereum and a basket of cryptocurrencies like BITW given the changing political and economic landscape. It emphasizes buying assets below intrinsic value and being prepared for increased inflation and deficit concerns.

articles.title: Three Reasons to Avoid Corning and One Stock to Buy Instead
articles.summary: This article analyzes why investors should be cautious with Corning (GLW) despite its recent stock performance. The author highlights three main reasons: sluggish long-term revenue growth, stalled EPS growth, and low return on invested capital. Instead, the article recommends considering ServiceNow and other "Strong Momentum Stocks" for the upcoming bull run.

articles.title: FAAS stock touches 52-week low at $0.5 amid market challenges
articles.summary: Stonebridge Acquisition's (FAAS) stock has fallen to a 52-week low of $0.5, reflecting a significant -95.23% decline over the past year. This downturn highlights volatility and challenges for the company, further corroborated by InvestingPro Insights indicating weak gross profit margins and a market capitalization of $36.14 million. The article also touches upon a separate company, DigiAsia Corp., and its recent strategic collaborations and acquisitions in the fintech sector.

articles.title: Can I Buy a Bitcoin Spot ETF in The UK? | Morningstar UK
articles.summary: Retail investor interest in Bitcoin has surged following a record high price and the approval of spot Bitcoin ETFs in the U.S. However, UK investors are currently unable to directly buy these U.S. ETFs due to regulatory differences and the FCA's cautious stance on cryptocurrency. The article explores the reasons behind the UK's stricter regulations and alternative ways for investors to gain exposure to Bitcoin.

articles.title: Here's How Much You Would Need to Invest in This Unstoppable Vanguard ETF Today to Grow Your Portfolio to $1 Million or More by Retirement
articles.summary: This article discusses using the Vanguard S&P 500 Growth Index Fund ETF Shares (VOOG) as a vehicle for long-term wealth accumulation, aiming for $1 million by retirement. It highlights the ETF's focus on growth stocks within the S&P 500, its low expense ratio, and historical outperformance. The author provides a table illustrating the investment amounts needed over 30 and 35 years, assuming an 8% annual growth rate, suggesting at least $70,000 for 35 years to reach the $1 million goal.

articles.title: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) Faces Competition as Chinese Chips from Zhaoxin Close the Gap in AI Race
articles.summary: Advanced Micro Devices (AMD) is facing increasing competition in the AI chip market from Chinese manufacturers like Zhaoxin, despite US export restrictions. While Chinese chips are improving, they still lag behind American technology. The article notes that AMD ranks 6th on a list of AI stocks, but suggests other AI stocks may offer higher returns.

articles.title: Vertiv Holdings' Philip O' Doherty sells $40.1 million in stock
articles.summary: Philip O' Doherty, Managing Director of E+I at Vertiv Holdings Co, sold 285,965 shares of Class A Common Stock for approximately $40.1 million. Despite the sale, O'Doherty retains a significant indirect stake in the company. The company has also shown strong financial growth and received positive analyst ratings, with an updated five-year plan anticipating $14.4 billion in sales by 2029 and a 25% margin target.

articles.title: VOOG vs. SCHG: Which Is the Better Growth Stock ETF?
articles.summary: This article compares two popular growth ETFs, the Vanguard S&P 500 ETF (VOOG) and the Schwab U.S. Large Cap Growth ETF (SCHG). While both are strong performers with similar portfolios of top growth stocks like Apple, Microsoft, and Nvidia, SCHG consistently outperforms VOOG in 3, 5, and 10-year returns and boasts a significantly lower expense ratio. The analysis concludes that SCHG is the better choice due to its superior performance and lower costs.

articles.title: Top KingWin (WAI) Stock Price, News & Analysis
articles.summary: Top KingWin (WAI) is a financial services company based in China, specializing in capital market education, support, and advisory services. The stock currently has a "Sell" consensus rating from analysts, a low MarketRank™ score, and does not pay a dividend. Recent news includes a 1-for-25 reverse share split in September 2025 and an earlier Nasdaq delisting notice due to stock price non-compliance.
